definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: The acceptability of real number system depends on practice.
sentences.chinese: 實數系統的可接受性依賴於實踐。

sentences.english: The acceptability of testing rose over time.
sentences.chinese: 檢測的可接受性隨着時間的推移逐步上升。

sentences.english: This has also had an impact on discussions about the acceptability of GM foods.
sentences.chinese: 這也已對關於轉基因食品可接受性的討論產生影響。

sentences.english: Consumer acceptability also has to be considered.
sentences.chinese: 而且還必須考慮消費者的可接受性。

definition: (mining) workability (of deposits of coal, ore etc)
